intro: Croton huajuapanensis, commonly known as Huajuapan croton, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
